alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 9:24PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts...New Hampshire...Rhode Island... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Nashua River At East Pepperell affecting Hillsborough, Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Assabet River At Maynard affecting Middlesex and Worcester Counties. Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. Concord River At Lowell affecting Middlesex County. Shawsheen River At Andover affecting Essex County. Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. For the Connecticut River...including Hartford, Northampton, Thompsonville, Middle Haddam...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Simsbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Nashua River...including East Pepperell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Concord River...including Lowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Shawsheen River...including Andover...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Charles River...including Dover...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Cranston...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Westerly...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawtuxet River at Cranston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Evacuations are likely near the Pawtuxet River in Warwick and Cranston. Both homes and businesses will be impacted from this flood event. Businesses and homes will be impacted on streets including but not limited to the following, in Warwick, Pioneer Avenue, Bellows Street, Venturi Avenue, and River Street. In Cranston, Wellington Avenue and Avery Road. In West Warwick, Daisy Street, the lower ends of Canna, Begonia and Aster Streets, and portions of Providence Street to Route 2. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday evening and continue falling to 8.2 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 04/17/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
